HomePageComponent.body:
*** USER ALERT *** PLEASE READ ***

 

This afternoon we made a decision to remove the newly introduced email functionality that was deployed in SalesForce.Com earlier this week. The intention of this change was to make the users experience a “more like” outlook feel that the majority of users are familiar with. In our deployment significant unexpected changes occurred that were a surprise to us all, in some scenarios, even hard to have planned for. However some functionality we did expect to lose, at the gain of more user requested functionality, a trade off of sorts.

 

The roll back will take approximately 2hrs this evening (March 3rd), starting at 7pm. A complete re-evaluation of the design against the requirements will follow. Lessons learned around the need for speedy deployments, making user acceptance testing more robust  and involving the right people through the process will be some of the items addressed. The reintroduction of the change will depend of many factors, including allowing Salesforce some time to troubleshoot the larger architectural issues. Once we are past this, we will  then develop a go-no go decision and eventual plan.

 

We apologize for any inconvenience, SFDC Team

 

*** USER ALERT *** PLEASE READ ***
